qas.question: In what year CE did the Second Muslim Civil War end?
During what period did the Berber Revolt occur?
What branch took over Umayyad leadership during the Second Civil War?
What caused unrest in the provinces inside Syria?
In what years did the First Muslim Civil War occur?
When did leadership shift from the Marwanid branch to the Sufyanid branch?
What year was the Caliphate of Cordoba started?

context: The <b3_0>rivalries between the Arab tribes<b3_0/> had caused unrest in the provinces outside Syria, most notably in the Second Muslim Civil War of <b4_0>680–<a0_0>692<a0_0/> CE<b4_0/> and the Berber Revolt of <a1_0>740–743 CE<a1_0/>. <b5_0>During the Second Civil War<b5_0/>, leadership of the Umayyad clan shifted from the Sufyanid branch of the family to the <a2_0>Marwanid<a2_0/> branch. As the constant campaigning exhausted the resources and manpower of the state, the Umayyads, weakened by the <b7_0>Third Muslim Civil War<b7_0/> of 744–747 CE, were finally toppled by the Abbasid Revolution in 750 CE/132 AH. A branch of the family fled across North Africa to Al-Andalus, where they established the Caliphate of Córdoba, which lasted until <b6_0>1031<b6_0/> before falling due to the Fitna of al-Ándalus.
